// ---------- 1 1 1
// ---------- 1 1 1
// ---------- 1 1 1

// displayed name for this testmode
[TESTMODE 1 NAME]
Set Gateway Mode

// a sequence for turning on the sequenc
[TESTMODE 1 SEQUENCE_ON]
aG #>

// a sequence, that is sent before X or before going into different
// test mode if module is in this test mode
[TESTMODE 1 SEQUENCE_OFF]


// hint for this test mode
[TESTMODE 1 HINT]
Set deafult parameters for Gateway mode

[]



// ---------- 2 2 2 
// ---------- 2 2 2 
// ---------- 2 2 2 

// displayed name for this testmode
[TESTMODE 2 NAME]
Set Router Mode

[TESTMODE 2 SEQUENCE_ON]
aR #> 
[TESTMODE 2 SEQUENCE_OFF]


[TESTMODE 2 HINT]
Set default parameters for Router mode.

[]



// ---------- 3 3 3
// ---------- 3 3 3
// ---------- 3 3 3

// displayed name for this testmode
[TESTMODE 3 NAME]
Test Mode 1 (TX On)

// a sequence for turning ont the sequence
[TESTMODE 3 SEQUENCE_ON]
a1 #>

// a sequence, that is sent before X or before going into different
// test mode if module is in this test mode
[TESTMODE 3 SEQUENCE_OFF]
a3 #>

// hint for this test mode
[TESTMODE 3 HINT]
TX carrier (lower FSK frequency)

[]

// ---------- 4 4 4

[TESTMODE 4 SEQUENCE_OFF]

[TESTMODE 5 SEQUENCE_OFF]

// ---------- 0x0B Max delay

[M 0x0B MIN_MAX]
1 255

[M 0x0B NAME]
Maximum packet latency


[M 0x0B HINT]
Maximum transport time before a packet
is judged as undeliverable, and eliminated.

Calculated as periods of 60 seconds.

Example : 
1   = 60 seconds 
255 = 15300 seconds (4 h 15 min)
	
[]

[M 0x0C HINT]
Number of unsuccessful RF retries before a Router or End node 
disconnects and attempts reconnecting to the network. 
	
[]

// ---------- 0x0D Serial Port Timeout
// ---------- 0x0D Serial Port Timeout
// ---------- 0x0D Serial Port Timeout

[M 0x0D MIN_MAX]
1 255

[M 0x0D NAME]
Serial port Time Out

[M 0x0D HINT]
Time out between character inputs on serial port before a 
packet is transmitted in Transparent mode.

Time is calculated as periods of 10ms

Examples:
1   =   10 ms
10  =  100 ms
255 = 2550 ms (Max value)

// ---------- 0x2B CTS hold
// ---------- 0x2B CTS hold
// ---------- 0x2B CTS hold

[M 0x2B MIN_MAX]
1 255

[M 0x2B NAME]
CTS Hold Time

[M 0x2B HINT]
CTS Hold Time in 10ms periods.

A timer holds CTS in FALSE status after Serial In buffer is ready to receive data.
The timer prevents Gateway data from entering the network at a too high rate.
Too much data traffic from the Gateway may overload the network, causing temporary disconnects.

// ---------- 0x35 UART BAUD RATE
// ---------- 0x35 UART BAUD RATE
// ---------- 0x35 UART BAUD RATE

[M 0x35 MIN_MAX]
1 11

[M 0x35 NAME]
UART baud rate

[M 0x35 HINT]
UART_BAUD_RATE
Baud rate.

0x00: Not used
0x01: 2400
0x02: 4800
0x03: 9600
0x04. 14400
0x05: 19200 (default)
0x06: 28800
0x07: 38400
0x08: 56700
0x09: 76800
0x0A: 115200
0x0B: 230400

BE CAREFUL
IF CHANGING AS HOST MAY LOOSE CONTACT WITH MODULE!
Does not take effect until module is re-booted / reset.

If COM port baudrate to connect is not listed in the 
Toolbar it can be typed in manually.
[]

//4:RXTX (RS485)
